title: Social Studies Extended Response 6
intro_text:
Social Studies

Welcome to the Social Studies Extended Response Test.

You have 25 minutes to complete the Extended Response.

The goal is to give you practice on the types of questions you will see on the GED® test. You will get a study plan that provides you help in the areas where you can improve.

The Extended Response will be graded on the following three areas:

  1. Arguments and Evidence: How well your response creates a logical argument using relevant evidence from the passage and accurate social studies knowledge.
  2. Organization and Development: How well your response logically develops your main idea with multiple examples. How well you organize your writing to communicate your message.
  3. Mechanics and Usage: How well your response follows the Standard English Conventions of spelling, word choice, punctuation, sentence structure and grammar.

Your Extended Response will be scored by our staff of teachers within 72 hours.
